definition: to elaborate (on a theme)/to expound (the classics)/perfunctory/to skimp/to botch/to do sth half-heartedly or just for show/barely enough to get by
to spread/to lay out/to apply (powder, ointment etc)/sufficient (to cover)/enough
to spread out/to develop/to overflow/to amplify/superfluous
to skimp/to work half-heartedly/not to bother
to skimp on the job/to work half-heartedly/not to take the job seriously

sentences.english: I smiled at him vaguely and went inside.
sentences.chinese: 我對他敷衍地一笑，走了進去。

sentences.english: She is very conscientious and never skimps through her work.
sentences.chinese: 她辦事認真，從不敷衍了事。

sentences.english: Britain and Italy should stop temporizing.
sentences.chinese: 英國和意大利應該停止敷衍了事。

sentences.english: They perfunctorily consoled him with a few words.
sentences.chinese: 他們敷衍了事地安慰了他幾句。

sentences.english: The old teacher was muddling on, and nobody could follow what he was trying to say.
sentences.chinese: 這位老教師在敷衍了事，誰也聽不懂他想說什麼。

sentences.english: She is very conscientious and never skimps her work.
sentences.chinese: 她辦事認真，從不敷衍了事。

sentences.english: He brushed by with a perfunctory wave to the crowd.
sentences.chinese: 他擦身而過，朝人羣敷衍地揮了揮手。

sentences.english: Patients complain that their doctors hustle them through appointments.
sentences.chinese: 病人抱怨他們的醫生看病敷衍了事。

sentences.english: He always plays fast and loose with his work.
sentences.chinese: 他對工作總是敷衍了事，不正經幹。

sentences.english: Many students in the course of employment because of their dedicated and halfheartedly.
sentences.chinese: 很多學生因爲求職過程的勞心勞力而對其敷衍了事。

sentences.english: I am sorry that he should be so half-hearted about the important work.
sentences.chinese: 遺憾，他對這項重要工作竟這樣敷衍塞責。

sentences.english: Stephen sweetened him up and put him off a week.
sentences.chinese: 史蒂芬把他敷衍了一番，往後推託了一個星期。

sentences.english: Does a good carver temporize to carve his seal?
sentences.chinese: 一個好的雕刻者不應敷衍他的印章。

sentences.english: I am busy say him insomnia perfunctorily , it is good to spend paragraph of time.
sentences.chinese: 我忙敷衍說自己失眠，過段時間就好了。

sentences.english: Don't scamp your work because you're pressed for time.
sentences.chinese: 不要因爲趕時間而敷衍了事。

definition: to skimp/to work half-heartedly/not to bother
to fool/to deceive/to go through the motions
to muddle through/to fob sb off/to beat around the bush/to dodge
to look for a pretext
to make an excuse/pretext/excuse
to evade/to shirk
to joke/to laugh insincerely/to make merry/to talk irrelevantly
false friendship/hypocritical show of affection
to praise/to speak highly of/compliment/praise
polite greeting/civilities/to exchange pleasantries
to make excuses/to give an excuse (for not doing something)
to praise/to applaud/to compliment
to get the desired outcome/to win favor by fawning on sb/to curry favor with/a fruitful outcome to reward one's labor
to deceive others and to deceive oneself/to believe one's own lies
false/untrue to one's convictions/against one's will/disloyal
conventional greeting/polite formula
